turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: What do you want to do now?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: How can you ask me that?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: You're making me feel guilty again.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Of what? Only God can point the finger, Loretta.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: And what do you know? You tell me my life? I'll tell you yours. I'm a wolf? You run to the wolf in me, that don't make you no lamb! You're gonna marry my brother? Why you wanna sell your life short? Playing it safe is just about the most dangerous thing a woman like you could do. You waited for the right man the first time, why didn't you wait for the right man again?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: The deal was if I came to the Opera with you you'd leave me alone forever.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I went with you.  Now I'm gonna marry Johnny and you're gonna leave me alone.  Right?  A person can see where they've messed up in their life, and they can change how they do things, and they can change their Luck. Maybe my nature does draw me to you, but I don't haveta go with that. I can take hold of myself and say yes to some things and no to something that's just gonna ruin everything! I can do that. Otherwise, what is this stupid life that God gave us for what?  Ronny? Are you listening to me?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I'm afraid of who I am.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: I don't know. Everything seems like nothing now against that I want you in my bed. I don't care if I burn in hell. I don't care if you burn in hell. The Past and Future is a joke to me now. I see that they're nothing, I see they ain't here. The only thing that's here is you. And me. I want you to come upstairs. Now. I tried to take everything last night, like you told me, but I couldn't. I couldn't take everything in a hundred years. It's the way we are. We compound each other.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Come upstairs. I don't care why you come. No, that's not what I mean. Loretta, I love you. Not like they told you love is and I didn't know this either. But love don't make things nice, it ruins everything, it breaks your heart, it makes things a mess. We're not here to make things perfect. Snowflakes are perfect. The stars are perfect. Not us. We are here to ruin ourselves and break our hearts and love the wrong people and die! The storybooks are bullshit. Come upstairs with me, baby! Don't try to live your life out to somebody else's idea of sweet happiness. Don't try to live on milk and cookies when what you want is meat! Red meat just like me! It's wolves run with wolves and nothing else! You're a wolf just like me! Come upstairs with me and get in my bed! Come on! Come on! Come on!

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Good! We can get this out on the table.  I'm Ronny, Johnny's brother.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: No, I'll tell him.  What am I going to tell him?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: What the hell are you talking about? We're engaged.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Loretta, what are you talking about?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I'm talking about a promise. You proposed to me!

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Will you marry me, Loretta Castorini Clark?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Before all these people, yes, I will marry you, Ronny Cammareri!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Sure you do. You got all that wedding stuff.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What's the matter? You look crazy.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I got a lot on my mind, Aunt Rita.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Bye, bye, honey. See you tomorrow?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Is there anything you want to tell us, honey?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: It's the oily fish tonight. Not before the plane ride.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Give him the manicotta, Bobo. Me, too.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: A man who can't control his woman is funny.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: She was too young for him.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: My scalp is not getting enough blood sometimes.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Are you proposing marriage to me?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You know I was married and that my husband died. But what you don't know is I think he and I had Bad Luck.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: We got married at the City Hall and I think it gave bad luck the whole marriage.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Right from the start we didn't do it right. Could you kneel down?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I helped you buy it. It came with two pairs of pants. It's for luck, Johnny. When you propose marriage to a woman, you should kneel down.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You propose to a woman you should offer her a ring of engagement.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: So we'll pick up the car, we'll make the plane in plenty of time.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: My mother is dying. When she is dead, I'll come back and we'll be married.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: How near is she to death?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: A week. Two weeks. No more.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: How about a month from today?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Must it be so definite? Can't we just say that we will be married when I get back?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Where? At the City Hall? No! I want the whole wedding or we will have Bad Luck. For a whole wedding to be planned, a date must be set.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Alright. A month. In a month.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I'll take care of it, Johnny. I'll take care of the whole thing. All you have to do is show up.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: I'll call you when I get to Mama's house.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: You've made me very happy, Johnny.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: There's one thing about this wedding I want you to do. Call this number. It's a business number. Ask for Ronny. Invite him to the wedding.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: We haven't spoken in five years. There was some bad blood. I want you to call him and invite him to the wedding. Will you do it?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Ssh, it's me. I'm calling from the deathbed of my mother.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: The waitresses were very nice.  My mother is slipping away.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Have you told her we're getting married?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Not yet. I'm waiting till a moment when she's peaceful.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I don't know. But Johnny, how did your mother recover? She was dying.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I can't. I need my family around me now.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Well. I told my mother that we were to be married. And she got well. Right away.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Johnny, I have something to tell you.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: I have something to tell you. But I must talk to you alone.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I have no secrets from my family.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: If I marry you my mother will die.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: And you're a big liar! I've got your ring here!

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: I must ask for that back.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: In time, you will see that this is the best thing.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: In time, you will drop dead, and I will come to your funeral in a red dress.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Good. When you love them they drive you crazy cause they know they can. But you like him?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Oh yeah. He's a sweet man. I wanna have a big church wedding, Ma. And a reception.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: And who's gonna pay for that?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I got married before, you didn't sell.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Grandma was still alive. Chiro was still home going to school. Now he's married and gone to Florida. If you and Johnny moved in, had a baby...

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What's thirty-seven? I had Chiro after I was thirty-seven. It ain't over till it's over.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Johnny has a big apartment. We'll live there.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I'd like to stay, Ma. I love the house. But Pop don't like Johnny.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: She's dying. But I could still hear her big mouth.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Not yet. That old lady makes him sweat.  Where's that card?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I don't wanna talk about it.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Just like your father. I lied to him. He thinks you came home last night.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Thanks. What's the matter with you?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Then you don't know. You're just imagining it. He's too old.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What the hell happened to you?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Well. I don't really know where to start.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No. But I have a hangover.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Upstairs. Johnny Cammareri showed up last night.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: A miracle? This is modern times! There ain't supposed to be miracles any more!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I guess it ain't modern times in Sicily. He came right from the airport. He wanted to talk to you. You got a love bite on your neck. He's coming back this morning.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Yeah, Ma, I love him awful.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Hey there  ...YOU WITH THE STARS IN YOUR EYES...

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Listen, I gotta go. I'll take the deposit to the bank but I'll do the books tomorrow. I gotta go.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Hi. Why ain't you at the store?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: We just come from the bank.

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: The bank. OH MY GOD, I FORGOT TO MAKE THE DEPOSIT!

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Bless me, Father, for I have sinned. It's been two months since my last confession.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: What sins have you to confess?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: Twice I took the name of God in vain, once I slept with the brother of my fiancé, and once I bounced a check at the liquor store -- but that was really an accident.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Then it was not a sin. But what was that second thing you said, Loretta?

turns.speaker: LORETTA
turns.text: I... a... slept with my fiancé's brother.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Alright. This is your penance. Say two rosaries and... be careful, Loretta. Reflect on your life.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: I absolve you in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit, Amen.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Lucy. There are big things going on in my house. My granddaughter Loretta, the only daughter of my son Cosmo, has engaged herself to be married a second time.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: I have heard that Johnny Cammareri got down on his knees in The Grand Ticino and proposed to her.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: My son does not like this Johnny Cammareri. He says he is a big baby.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: My granddaughter wants my son to pay for the wedding. But he does not want to pay.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: He owes her a wedding from the first time when there was none.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Maybe. I don't know. He has not asked my advice. If he asks my advice, I don't know what I will say.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: If I hit the stick too hard, the apple will split. If I am too timid, the apple will fall off the stick.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: Cosmo drank five glasses of wine at dinner.

turns.speaker: OLD MAN
turns.text: I will. But I must find the right moment.

turns.speaker: LUCY
turns.text: Did you see the moon last night?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: I came right from the airport.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Can you wake up Loretta? I need to talk to her.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: She's not home yet. Take off your coat and come in the living room. I'll make you a drink. I wanna talk to you.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Out. I don't know where. I was waiting up for my husband.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What are you doing here? You're supposed to be in Palermo.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: That's what I came to tell Loretta. There's been a miracle.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: The breath had almost totally left her body. She was as white as snow. And then she completely pulled back from death and stood up and put on her clothes and began to cook for everyone in the house. The mourners. And me. And herself! She ate a meal that would choke a pig!

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: That was my father-in-law, who has a wrong idea in his head. Listen, Johnny, there's a question I want to ask you. And I want you to tell me the truth if you can. Why do men chase women?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Well. There's the Bible story. God took a rib from Adam and made Eve. Maybe men chase women to get the rib back. When God took the rib, he left a hole there, place where there used to be something. and the women have that. Maybe a man isn't complete as a man without a woman.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: But why would a man need more than one woman?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe because he fears death.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No, that's really it. Thank you for answering my question.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: He doesn't like you. Thank you for answering my question.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: You don't know where Loretta is?

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Then tell her I'll come by in the morning. We need to talk.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Ronny! Our mother has recovered from death!

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Have you come to make peace with me?

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: Well. Yeah. You may not want to.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: Because my mother was dying! But now she's not.

turns.speaker: RONNY
turns.text: You're forty-two years old, Johnny, and Mama is still running your life.

turns.speaker: MR. JOHNNY
turns.text: And you are a son who doesn't love his mother!

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Could you do away with her dinner, and any evidence of her, and bring me an big glass of vodka?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Can I get another one of these?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: May I presume to ask you a question?

turns.speaker: SHY WAITER
turns.text: I am alone in the world.

turns.speaker: SHY WAITER
turns.text: When I was twenty-seven years old, in Jersey City, I asked a woman to marry me. She had red hair. She smelled a jasmine. She wore black shoes with pointy white tips.

turns.speaker: SHY WAITER
turns.text: She didn't hear me. She asked me to repeat, so she could understand what I said. But I wouldn't repeat it. Outta shyness. So I'm a bachelor.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Don't mind about me. But could you do me a favor and clear her place and take away all evidence of her, and bring me a big glass of vodka?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I'm sorry if we disturbed you.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: My lady friend has a personality disorder.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: She was just too young for you.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Ouch. Too young! I just got that. You know how to hurt guy. How old are you?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: Will you join me for dinner?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Then I'd be delighted. I hate eating alone, and it's amazing how often I end up doing just that.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I'm a professor. I teach communications at N.Y.U.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: That woman was a student of yours?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Sheila? Yes she was. Is. Was.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: There's old saying my mother told me. Would you like to hear it?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I'll remember that. What do you do?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Then why are you eating alone?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I'm not eating alone. Can I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: I think it's because they fear death.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Maybe. Listen. You wanna know why I chase women? I find women charming.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I teach these classes I've taught for a million years. The spontaneity went out of it for me a long time ago. I started off, I was excited about something and I wanted to share it. Now it's rote, it's the multiplication table. Except sometimes. Sometimes I'm droning along and I look up, and there's this fresh young beautiful face, and it's all new to her and I'm this great guy who's just brilliant and thinks out loud. And when that happens, when I look out among those chairs and look at a young woman's face, and see me there in her eyes, me the way I always wanted to be and maybe once was, then I ask her out on a date. It doesn't last. It can go for a few weeks or a couple of precious months, but then she catches on that I'm just a burnt out old gasbag and that she's as fresh and bright and full of promise as moonlight in a martini. And at that moment, she stands up and throws a glass of water in my face, or some action to that effect.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: What you don't know about women is a lot.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: May I walk with you a ways?

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I guess you can't invite me in?

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: No. I think the house is empty. I can't invite you in because I'm married and because I know who I am. You're shaking.

turns.speaker: ROSE
turns.text: You're a little boy and you like to be bad.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: We could go to my apartment. You could see how the other half lives.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: I'm too old for me. That's my predicament.

turns.speaker: PERRY
turns.text: Good night. Can I kiss you on the cheek, too?

turns.speaker: PERRY'S VOICE
turns.text: I live in a one-bedroom apartment. What exactly does your husband do?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: Cosmo. Many years ago, when they told me you were marrying my sister, I was happy. When I told Rose I was marrying Rita, she was happy.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What are you talking about, Raymond? Cosmo can't own the moon.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I mean it's that moon I was talking about at dinner.  Is he down there? No.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What would he be doing down there?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: You know, in this light, and with that expression on your face, you look about twenty-five years old.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I feel great I got no sleep but I feel like Orlando Furioso!

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: You were a tiger last night.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: And you were a lamb. As soft as milk.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Shut up. They'll hear you in the back.

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: So what? The pleasure of marriage is you sleep with the woman and then you don't worry about nothing. Hey, how about a date tonight, Rita. Let's eat pasta and roll around.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: Raymond, Raymond, lower your voice! What's got into you?

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: I don't know! That moon! That crazy moon Cosmo sent over!

turns.speaker: RAYMOND
turns.text: You see that moon last night?

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: What are you talking about, you fool? Her fiancé's in Palermo.

turns.speaker: RITA
turns.text: We didn't know what to think. You were so weird yesterday, and then this morning, we go to the bank and no bag.

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: How do you know she is a witch?

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: She looks like one. Yes, she does.

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: A witch,  a witch,  burn her!

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Did you dress her up like this?

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Quiet! Quiet!  There are ways of telling whether she is a witch.

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: There are?  Tell up.  What are they, wise Sir Bedevere?

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Tell me ...  what do you do with witches?

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: And what do you burn, apart from witches?

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: So how can we tell if she is made of wood?

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Ah.  Yes, of course ... um ... err ...

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: No, no,  It floats.   Throw her in the pond Tie weights on her.  To the pond.

turns.speaker: BEDEVERE
turns.text: Wait.  Wait ... tell me, what also floats on water?

turns.speaker: ALL
turns.text: Bread?  No, no, no.  Apples .... gravy ... very small rocks ...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: It is I, Arthur, son of Uther Pendragon, from the castle of Camelot.  King of all Britons, defeator of the Saxons, sovereign of all England!

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: I am...  And this my trusty servant, Patsy. We have ridden the length and breadth of the land in search of knights who will join our court at Camelot..  I must speak with your lord and master.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: You've got two empty halves of coconuts and you're banging them together.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: So?  We have ridden since the snows of winter covered this land, through the kingdom of Mercea.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Where did you get the coconuts?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Found them?  In Mercea.  The coconut's tropical!

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Well, this is a temperate zone.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: The swallow may fly south with the sun, or the house martin or the plover seek warmer hot lands in winter, yet these are not strangers to our land.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Not at all.  They could be carried.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: What? A swallow carrying a coconut?

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: It's not a question of where he grips it,  It's a simple matter of weight - ratios ...  A five-ounce bird could not hold a a one pound coconut.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Well, it doesn't matter.   Go and tell your master that Arthur from the Court of Camelot is here.

turns.speaker: SOLDIER
turns.text: Look! To maintain Velocity, a swallow needs to beat its wings four hundred and ninety three times every second.   right?

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: Where does he live?  Old man ... where does he live ...

turns.speaker: SOOTHSAYER
turns.text: He knows of a cave ... a cave which no man has entered.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: And ... the Grail ... The Grail is there?

turns.speaker: SOOTHSAYER
turns.text: There is much danger ... for beyond the cave lies the Gorge of Eternal Peril which no man has ever crossed.

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: But the Grail ... where is the Grail!?

turns.speaker: SOOTHSAYER
turns.text: Seek you the Bridge of Death ...

turns.speaker: ARTHUR
turns.text: The Bridge of Death? ... which leads to the Grail?
